reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Should have purchased one decades ago
reviews.reviewText: 3 years now / quality product and the toilet is built to outlast my home.For someone with IBS, hemorrhoids there is nothing better than a bidet!This models warm water, oscillating stream, heated seat - is so soothing.My life has literally changed for the better due to this product. Thank you WOODBRIDGEE!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Woodbridge T-0737 one piece toilet with built in electronic bidet Is perfection
reviews.reviewText: This review is specifically for Woodbridge T-0737 one piece toilet with built in electronic bidet. The reviews found here are obviously for all Woodbridge toilets, not just this model. I ordered and installed 2 units at our home, we already have 2 other electronic bidets on 2 other Kohler Riator one piece toilets and have been using them for many years.The form is beautiful, one piece smooth aerodynamic oval shape, rivals any of the $4000-$7000 modern toilets, just right for our modern all white décor and perfect for any mansions. The bidet fits perfectly forming a smooth oval spaceship like sculpture. A very beautiful art form by itself.The height is just right for 6’ tall male and shorter wife. The flushing is flawless with no mark. The sitting water level is good, a little on the low side but not as empty as those new annoying European toilets, the water level is perfectly fine. The tank top buttons work perfectly, instant flushing without delay. This does not have a deodorant feature, our 2 other bidets have deodorant feature, I notice no difference.The electronic bidet is perfect. Water pressure is gentle yet effective, seat warmer is a bit too hot for me at full level, I use level 2 out of 5 or 6, adjustable nozzle position is good, fan is powerful with adjustable heat. Massage function doesn’t do massage but moves ½” back and forth to handle a far more effective function, with minimum paper needed. The size and shape is a perfect fit for this spaceship like all white smooth oval toilet. Water tank is hidden in the overall over one piece art form.The installation was done by plumber, $400 for 2 toilets, including disposal of 2 older Kohler Riator toilets. One bathroom is 3 levels down, a bit of extra work by 2, as all these toilets are very heavy. Woodbridge unit is 152 Ibs. It took 1.5 hours to remove and install each toilet, plumber said it is very easy, no complication, I did not help.This Woodbridge T-0737 one piece toilet with built in electronic bidet is so wonderful, it is now the only one I use, it is like civilization just arrived here at home, even though we have 4 bidets at home. I immediately ordered 3 more Woodbridge T-0737 one piece toilet with built in electronic bidet, 1 for my office, 2 more for my son’s home.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2022
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This is a great toilet, I love it. It is quite tall and the seat is somewhat angled so you sit quite forward than in a regular toilet. The bidet is nice but not perfect. The pressure is not very high. I've had free standing bidets and they give you a lot more pressure. The drier is nice but doesn't really dry very much its more of a warmer. So much for reducing the use of toilet paper. You are going to need to dry your behind with toilet paper unless you are prepared to wait 10 minutes air drying your butt. I'm not saying that the toilet isn't great, it is. I am very happy with it. I just want to keep your expectations realistic. Its a toilet with a bidet and a drier built in. It's not going to be as good as three separate dedicated things. For a tiny bathroom its awesome. Also it has a night light. How cool is that?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Everything is excellent except the MAIN function
reviews.reviewText: Everything about this toilet is excellent except 2 things. The seat automatically turns on when you sit, and off when you get off, the blue light is bright but not jarring and also automatic (light sensor). The blow drier is a bit gimmicky but gets plenty hot, the massage function means you don't have to shimmy around while washing but there are 2 main issues. Installation is a headache, it's super heavy, it's one peice and the bolts are hidden, which looks nicer once it's installed but I went through 4 wax rings guessing if the bolts were lined up or not (you can't see them). The other main issue is the bidet pressure it just *barely* is enough on maximum pressure. My $20 "luxe bidet" addon could get painfully powerful if you wanted it, this thing doesn't even come close. It works, but it would be awesome if the pressure was there.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High quality and high value!
reviews.reviewText: I spent a great deal of time researching options before making this purchase. I have wanted a toilet/bidet unit for several years. So, as we planned the remodel of our master bath, this product came to my attention. We had the bathroom professionally remodeled and and the bidet installed by the contractor. However, it is heavy and I did assist when it came time to set the base of the unit. Installation went very well with no surprises along the way.This is day two with our new Woodbridge and all I can say is this... I have been using the restroom incorrectly for my entire life. I no longer consider this a luxury purchase. To me, it is a must have and I do not look forward to using a restroom away from home. I plan to purchase two more of this model to install in the other bathrooms in our home.I find this to be extremely easy to operate and the quality of the unit seems to be top notch!*Update 4-5-21 Still extremely pleased with this product. So much so, that I am ordering three more for our new home that is currently being built. Could not imagine going back to toilet paper after using this toilet/bidet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Bidet toilet not very functional
reviews.reviewText: Just installed the Woodbridge bidet toilet and the pressure coming out from the spray Nozzle is very weak, The remote function to increase and decrease pressure does not work, Neither does the massage function.very disapointed with the customer service as they cannot do much to help.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Bidet sprayer flow is weak
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had this toilet for 10 months. 2 months in, the bidet function completely stopped working. Customer service was difficult to communicate with by email with large pauses in time between messages. They had me go through steps to reset. When it didn’t work, they sent a new bidet attachment. That has worked fine for 6 months but the water flow and width of stream just doesn’t get the job done. I wish I had just paid more for a reputable brand. The other functions are adequate but the whole reason for buying was to get a clean hole without wipes..
